list_definition.definition: a room where objects for sale etc are displayed for people to see

list_ex_of_english: But showrooms are often not listed in phone books, because the corporation prefers inquires to be directed to the regional depots.
Previously, it took over 5 years to bring a car from inception to showroom.
We are opposed to the removal of the corporation's rights to retail gas appliances and the proposed sale of showrooms to private enterprise.
Instead, there are to be warehouses, motorcar showrooms, and the like.
Up and down the country these showrooms are on prime sites in every high street and in all the new shopping precincts.
The argument that we must maintain highly expensive central high street showrooms for the payment of accounts does not hold water.
Accordingly, the order that shipped from the factory often failed to match the showroom samples the customer had seen when placing his or her order.
This addition will help to fill a gap and will bring products out of the backroom and into the showroom.
